text.text: Though we had to wait for a while to check in inspite of our prior bookings I must candidly admit that our entire stay at Sterling Ooty- Fern Hill will be cherished forever. Loved the aura of the place, its serenity, the salubrious weather, the food, the sports and allied activities. Will treasure it for a lifetime and if God willing  would definitely repeat visit this place. Thanks to the team for making this happen. Keep up the good work!

text.text: Very nice experience staying in Sterling Fern hill Ooty. Room was neat and clean. The staff is excellent and take care of your needs and requests. Breakfast buffet spread is more than sufficient. Mattress could be harder, but that could be personal preference for me. Location is 15min from Ooty central area.. no problem if you have your own vehicle, road is good. Location is good in a way that there is no city noise, and being higher up.. the weather is better than city and air is fresh. Would come back again, no hesitation in recommending.

text.text:
We booked a family suite. It is huge which was a plus. Overall the rooms were dated, bathrooms had severe grime buildup on the tiles, linens were rough.

We booked a 2 night stay, on the first night, the food made the whole family sick. Upon an early check out the next day, they refused to refund us the 2nd night.

The two positive notes were the two gentlemen working the ropes courses etc. They were great with our kids. The location/weather/views are great.

If this was a 2-3 star hotel, most of these complaints may be fine. But as a 5 star, this is unacceptable. Highly recommend looking elsewhere.

Look elsewhere, and save the money.

text.text: one of the best south indian cuisine restaurant in ooty but very poor service and management. no doubt the food is good but the place gets crowded and jam during peak hours specially during morning breakfast time. zero crowd management. we were literally running table to table to get a space, zero management involvement was witnessed. self service during peak hours was like standing in free langar line (actually langars are better managed). very poor lighting and ventilation inside the restaurant. only one cash counter for this kind of crowd is not enough. parking available behind the restaurant but no signboards forced us to struggle and find a free parking in the main market lane. at least they should have some staff outside the restaurant. overall not recommended considering the kind of service with that pricing. but yes if you dont care about the service and ready for it then surely the food is good.

text.text:
Adyar Ananda Bhavan - A2B

Located on - commercial road, next to the charring cross - Adam's fountain.

Parking space is huge, If you are in a car you can park it in their free parking lot. Bikes can be parked on the road and that is up to you.

It may be a high rated place in the area and famous outlet in Ooty for dine-in. I had a very poor experience at this outlet. The restaurant was too noisy and loud sounds were heard from working staff, I felt like I was inside a Market area.
Felt there is shortage of staff. One person running around taking orders and serving for 10 tables! Tables occupied -  where customers were sitting idle - din know whether they are waiting for food.
Pathetic service with zero cleanliness/hygiene in the dining area. Ooty A2B franchise spoils the reputation of A2B. Waiting time is almost 30min for each order. Even after requesting the staff for getting the table and the floor cleaned, barely anyone responded.

Restaurant pricing is little higher compared to other A2B outlets,

Self service - food pricing should be seprate and low.

Only cash accepted, no proper staff to handle -  UPI payment and card payment

We came to enjoy Ooty - not to tour Ooty A2B - lots of time got wasted as per our schedule. A2B is not a tourist spot. It's over hyped.

This is for the A2B in ooty. Simple straight suggestion. Do not go. The staff is least bothered to take orders.

text.text: Had breakfast at Anandha Bhavan. We tried vada, masala dosa, rava masala dosa, aloo paratha, ghee roast, kesari, and poori. The food is a bit too expensive; one vada costs 50. The chutney was okay but needed more salt. Kesari was really yummy. Other dishes were tasty too. They offer South Indian, North Indian, and chats on their menu as well.They have clean bathrooms and parking in the basement.

editorialSummary.text: Functional, modern rooms & suites in a resort with an international restaurant & a 24-hour cafe.

text.text: I am a NRI and stayed 3 days in this resort. I had Worst experience with this resort. There are all college students as staff at reception counter, They don't know how to deal with customer and don't know how to Welcome guest. There are only 4-5 experience staff members and remaining are college students. Food was worst, they serve cold food. They don't care about guests. In my room, washroom shower was broken, they don't do proper quality check before any guest check-in to the room. Room service was worst, they even don't drop your luggage inside to your room, they dropped my luggage at the room's door itself. They don't provide any invoice also, at the time of checkout , they advised that I will receive invoice copy over the email, now 15 days completed but there is no email invoice. I will recommend that stay away from this so called luxury resort. I am very disappointed from their services, I never expect this type of service from Sterling group of Hotels staff.

text.text:
I stayed at this supposed 4-star hotel (which essentially should be a 1-star hotel) with my family, including three members aged 60+, and three members aged 30+, for 3 nights and 4 days, mainly for New Year.

Here are detailed reasons why you should avoid this hotel:

1. The room provided for elderly people requires climbing stairs, causing severe discomfort for those with knee pain.
2. Most staff speak only English and Hindi, making it challenging for Tamil-speaking individuals to communicate.
3. Room toilets were poorly maintained, with broken seat covers and bad odor. Despite raising the issue, no action was taken until I had to shout.
4. The extra mattress provided was essentially a sofa, a poor choice for a 4-star hotel.
5. They charged approximately 20k for 6 adults on New Year's night, with organizers exclusively using Hindi and English, ignoring complaints from Tamil speakers.
6. Despite being a 4-star hotel, they had only one lift, and it was under maintenance during part of our stay. Staff and the manager were unhelpful, causing significant struggles for our elderly family members.
7. Room service and dine-in were frustrating as staff only spoke English and Hindi, often ignoring requests.
8. The hotel arranged a live kitchen in front of rooms without exhaust, causing more discomfort than the toilet odor.
9. The New Year party next to our rooms led to an entire night of frustration. We considered vacating the room at midnight due to our elderly parents.
10. When raising concerns about English and Hindi-speaking staff to the manager, he suggested that Hindi is our national language, refusing further discussion.
11. I booked a studio photoshoot, but it was later informed to be on B2 level, accessible only via stairs or the non-functional lift.
12. Requesting a campfire, I was misinformed about its location, and the manager suggested going to B2 level via stairs due to the non-functional lift.
13. The hotel lacks a "DO NOT DISTURB" sign, resulting in room service knocking even when guests are sleeping.
14. Room service changed blankets but left the old ones in the room, requiring an additional call for cleanup.

Conclusion:

Avoid this hotel if:
- You have elderly family members who cannot climb stairs.
- You cannot speak Hindi.
- You can't tolerate bad odors from poorly maintained toilets.
- You're unwilling to tolerate poor responses from the manager.
- You want to avoid a disastrous vacation experience.

text.text:
I stayed at this supposed 4-star hotel (which essentially should be a 1-star hotel) with my family of 12 members, including three members aged 50+, and three members aged 30+, for 3 nights and 4 days, during Pongal holidays.

Let me get to the plus!

Room has great facilities and a great view!
Play area and activities for kids and family!

Here are detailed reasons why you should avoid this hotel:

During check in they didn’t have the systems updated about the full payments I made and got us waiting for more time to check in.
The reception staff couldn’t handle the pressure during busy time and showed an attitude while getting adhar cards!

1. They said it was an upgrade and provided family suite which was not that great, one of the rooms is small!
When I initially made the booking for 6 premier rooms together 10 days back and was promised to get the same.

I couldn’t get back and change the rooms as we were all tried after a 10 hours journey!

2. The extra mattress provided was essentially a sofa, a poor choice for a 4-star hotel.

3. Despite being a 4-star hotel, they had only one lift in the reception area. Staff and the manager were unhelpful, causing significant struggles for our elderly family members.

4. Room service changed blankets but left garbage bins full in the room, requiring an additional call for cleanup.

5. The breakfast buffet was only South Indian food, I expected more continental but couldn’t find anything except pancake and cereal!

6. During check out upon trying to get the bags to the reception nobody turned up after 3 times of calling!

All of us carried our bags to the reception and on the way many staff noticed and still nobody even bothered to help!

Which was a huge led down for me!

The property lacks serious people skills  and needs training for their staff to be more courteous!

They also constantly tried to sell their membership to me, which was a bit annoying!

text.text: We visited Hyderabad Biryani House after having read at Thomas Cook Travels that its number one ranked in Ooty of multi cuisine dishes. We ordered Mutton Kadahi, Chapati and chicken Biryani. All the spices are well proportionate with less chilli. Such a delicious Food is not seen in even 5 star hotels having travelled extensively in India UK and abroad. On to the top they provided is complimentary moctel and sitting at First floor which has excellent scenic view of Ooty Hill. Highly recommended this place for eating out in Ooty. Ashiq (Chef) Mohit, Suraj and Irshad deserves special appreciation with thanks.

text.text: Posting my review here as I am unable to do it on Trip Advisor. My overall rating would be 4/5. A must try place! Earl's Secret is a cozy, beautiful place surrounded by beautiful flowers, welcoming staff and delicious but pricey food. When we came in before 6pm and the sun was still out, I loved the greenery and the vast amount of flowers and the looks and feels of the rooms from the outside. Beautiful place I shall say. Come dinner time, for starters we had the chilli chicken and it was ok for me. Am not too much of a fan of spicy food but it was ok. For the main dish, we ordered butter naan and Dhaba chicken. It was yum but I think a bit too expensive. Although they did mention though that they use high quality ingredients. The staff were great, especially Pinki and one other guy I didn't get the name of. They were really attentive of our needs and were really nice. Kudos to the team for a job well done and compliments to the chef!

text.text: Earl's Secret is part of a century-old British Mansion converted to Hotel King's Cliff and a restaurant. It has all the nostalgia, romance and grandeur of the bygone era. The restaurant has various sitting options (inside, outside and glasshouse as well). Menu seems to be well curated along with the decor and overall ambience of the place is very appealing. Food is outstanding. All the deserts are a must have. Service is top notch. Will definitely visit this again.

text.text: Nestled in a picturesque green mountain setting with pleasant weather, this location is perfect for families. Amidst nature, adults can unwind while kids enjoy various games. Spacious banquet halls and lawns are available for celebrating memorable moments. The friendly staff offers top-notch service. Clean rooms with balconies provide stunning nature views and refreshing breezes. Watching sunrise and sunset is a delightful bonus. The food is delicious and well-presented, including lawn snacks. It's an outstanding place to relax, enjoy nature, and create lasting memories.

text.text:
Absolutely thrilled with my recent stay at this Accord Highland Ooty! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm smiles and impeccable service that lasted throughout my entire stay. The attention to detail in the room was astonishing – it was clean, spacious, and beautifully appointed with all the amenities I could ask for.

The staff went above and beyond to make my experience memorable. They were always ready to assist with any request, whether it was arranging transportation or providing recommendations for local attractions. I was truly impressed by their dedication to ensuring that every guest felt valued and well taken care of.

One of the highlights was definitely the delicious dining options available on-site. The restaurant offered a delectable array of dishes that catered to various tastes, and the breakfast spread was simply divine – a great way to start each day of my stay.

Furthermore, the hotel's location was perfect for exploring the city. It was conveniently situated near key landmarks and attractions, making it easy for me to venture out and discover the area without any hassle.

All in all, my experience at this hotel was beyond exceptional. I left feeling rejuvenated and grateful for the wonderful memories created during my stay. I can't wait to return and relive this fantastic experience. Kudos to the entire team for their outstanding hospitality!

text.text:
Accord Highland in Ooty is like a hidden gem tucked away in the lush hills. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with warmth and impeccable service. The rooms offer breathtaking views of the surrounding hills, and the cool mountain air was a refreshing change.

The in-house restaurant served up a delightful array of local and international cuisine, catering to every palate. What truly sets this place apart is its tranquil ambiance; it's the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of city life.

It's the kind of place where you find peace, adventure, and unforgettable memories all in one. I can't wait to return!

I recently dined at Le Cafe in Ooty, Tamil Nadu and it was an extraordinary food experience.

The ambiance is great, making it a cool spot to hang out. Do visit 👍🏻

text.text:
Our stay at the Thalaserry hotel in Ooty left much to be desired. From the onset, we encountered significant delays in placing our food order, leading to a frustrating wait. This lapse in service set a disappointing tone for our experience.

Regrettably, the culinary aspect did not compensate for the initial inconvenience. The taste of the food fell short of expectations when compared to other establishments in the vicinity. The flavors lacked the finesse and quality we anticipated, leaving us dissatisfied with our dining experience.

In addition to the service and culinary disappointments, the ambiance and overall atmosphere of the restaurant failed to make a positive impression. It's disheartening when a visit to a hotel not only falls short of expectations but also fails to provide the basic elements of a satisfying dining experience.

In conclusion, our time at the Thalaserry hotel in Ooty was marred by prolonged waiting times, subpar food quality, and an overall lackluster ambiance. We sincerely hope that these issues are addressed, allowing future patrons to enjoy a more seamless and enjoyable visit.

text.text:
Visited the Thalassery restaurant for breakfast and had a rather disappointing experience. Most breakfast items on the menu were unavailable, including coffee.

Ordered putt and nadan chicken curry, paying ₹170 for curry that had only three very small chicken pieces, which was quite disappointing. The curry lacked thickness and seemed overly peppery.

Additionally, the Appam was not properly cooked. At the payment counter, we overheard other customers complaining about the chicken curry, and when we raised the issue, the staff seemed uninterested.

Despite the good ambiance, seating, and interior, the overall dining experience fell short of expectations.

editorialSummary.text: Unassuming rooms with cable TV in a no-nonsense hotel offering a modest restaurant & a garden.

text.text:
Had a wonderful time at the hotel. Had come here with my dad. Taking long walks in the garden with dad was great. Also, the room was very clean and spacious with the wonderful 24/7 geyser. After dinner , enjoyed playing carrom with my father in the game room. The restaurant food was amazing with prompt and quick service.
To sum it up, I loved the hospitality of the staff , be it at the restaurant or the reception. One thing that I am sure of is next time when I come to Ooty, I would be staying at your resort for sure. It’s best recommended if you are coming with family here.

text.text:
We stayed in this Hotel in May-2023. Our stay at Hotel Mayura Sudarshan was quite good and met all our expectations. Below is my feedback
PROS:
Good locality to stay in. Very peaceful surroundings. Perfect getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city. Very scenic location
There is a KSTDC Horticulture garden with ample space right next to the hotel, which is free for hotel guests.
Good and clean rooms which is quite spacious for a family of 3.
Hot water available for 24hrs.
Attached Restaurant with good breakfast options. Breakfast is also quite good.
A small indoor gaming area with the following games for some light fun activity
- Carrom
- Chess
- Ludo/Snake and Ladders
- A couple of badminton rackets
Food can be ordered to your Hotel rooms{only snacks though}
Staff was very good.
Massage service was also available in case anyone is interested. I found the rates quite reasonable.
CONS:
Chinese food at the restaurant needs significant improvement. I would not recommend ordering any kind of Chinese food from this hotel's restaurant.
If you forget to carry any basic items then you would probably need to travel to the city center to get it. This could be a problem in case you do not have your own personal transport.
Service at the restaurant can get a bit slow at times especially when there are a lot of customers.
Many items from the menu were unavailable. Considering it was peak season and Hotel was completely booked, they should have taken care of this.

NOTE:- If you are traveling with a driver he will have to probably sleep in the vehicle as no separate accommodation is provided for him. However other things such as blankets, pillows etc.. and access to bathrooms will be provided.

text.text: The hotel had an antique touch. The architecture was like a mugal building. I could notice Taxidermy, the art of preserving, arranging, and displaying animal bodies so they can be hung on hunters' walls or set up in natural history museums. The heads of Deer and Bison were preserved and presented in this way. The hotel gives us a vintage feel. Let it be the construction, lighting and the facilities. But the food is not that vintage😂🤭It's fresh n nice. They've arranged a campfire for us, right infront of the Hotel itself. We not only enjoyed the campfire but also celebrated Christmas by cutting cakes. The night view from the Restaurant was super cool. The distant radiant dots were twinkling like gems.

text.text:
I gotta tell you about my stay at this hotel from 16/12/23 to 17/12/23 until 11 o'clock – it was just awful. The room was a letdown, seriously lacking basic stuff and not well taken care of.

The tiny toilets were just uncomfortable, and the noise in the hotel made sleeping impossible. Even though the hotel is close to Ooty Lake, the problems we faced overshadowed any good.

The worst part? The service was terrible. Caught the staff doing things they shouldn't, like drinking alcohol. It was unprofessional and totally disappointing.

And guess what? They promised amenities, but no free breakfast, no Wi-Fi – it was a letdown. The whole experience was way below what we paid for.

Eating there? Don't even get me started. The promised stuff just didn't happen. I've got complaints and concerns, and I hope the management fixes things up real quick. They need to step up with better staff, room quality, and overall service.

text.text:
I booked 2 rooms using agoda and the payment is pay directly to hotel. As is came around 4pm after sight seeing the hotel receptionist said they don't have any rooms left and they are sold out, no one reached for my confirmation and I called them multiple times today morning and messaged in agoda platform to inform about late checkin but no one picked my call and now they gave lame reply stating they are busy in checkout existing customers.

Now here comes the tragedy, I booked 2 rooms for 1500 per room so 3k in total, my receptionist gave me offer that they have one room and they will arrange another extra bed for 2500, which I denied at first and then they are ok with 2k for one room with extra bed. Now I went to see the room, the rooms are very narrow which is only sufficient for 2 members and the extra bed has to be laid in front of washroom.

So I declined their offer and checked in the nearby hotel which offers great view and pocket friendly.

Please avoid booking this hotel.

If anyone wants to know the hotel which in check in with great view give me a thumps up.

text.text: We went here for dinner in September. Lovely place with great views. I wish I could give 10 stars for the service. The staff were amazing. We were very tired after a long journey. The chef made us a very flavorful garlic and herbs spaghetti which was “the best” I have tasted outside of Italy.

text.text: The lavender flower ice cream was decent, offering a subtle floral flavor. However, what stood out more was the delightful ambiance. The overall experience was enhanced by the inviting atmosphere, making it a pleasant place to enjoy a treat.😌

text.text:
The place is great with good ambience and nice location.

The price point may seem little high for some but totally worth it because the food the serve deserves it .

The food choices are plenty and they have vast options like bakery items , pot pies , Lasagna, pizza , ice creams , pasta , fish and chips and other continental items.

They have a small area  for purchasing clothes as well

They have ample parking space also .

The person in charge Mr. Manoj was very sweet , helpful & welcoming .

Had a nice time

text.text:
Visited this place after seeing a food vlog in YouTube about their special lavender ice cream. The ice cream is good, must try dish.

Had chicken pot pie and pasta from there, along with black label.
The service was so good just like the food.

Calm and neat place, one of the must visit place in Ooty.

text.text: Upscale restaurant offering continental and outside Indian cuisine with an Indian flavour. Ample parking . I really liked the white white interiors around.  Very well lit naturally. Clean and neat all around . Waiters wearing predominantly white are also impressive . Food is great . Desserts are even better . Pizza is good . Alfredo Pasta was not at all up to the mark . Quantity is less and price is slightly on the higher side . Overall a decent place .

text.text:
The atmosphere and the welcoming smell while you enter the place is great as usual. The food was good as usual. It keeps up to the domino’s reputation.

But the service here was awful. We were waiting for 1 hour for our takeaway order. We even heard a fire alarm being triggered 3 times during our waiting time. Looks like there are only 2 people who manage this place.

Few customers who came after us to give order, even left after sometime. There was no one to attend them.

Service needs to be improved a lot!

text.text: Pathetic service. There's only one person to take the orders, clean the tables(that too only after asking the only employee to send someone to clean). It took ages to get our order prepared. We ordered a couple of pizzas and zingy parcel and it took around 30mins to get it prepared. Feeling sad for the lady who is managing everything alone there.

text.text:
Horrible experience with staff (Name Prasila, as her colleague told me) I made an order online for Butter scotch Mouse cake, it was showing 30 minutes to deliver, I called to say that, can I collect the order by myself?

This lady received the order and mentioned that, we can not deliver your order I am cancelling it, before I say anything she already cancelled.

text.text:
An Old Style House Converted into a Dominos Outlet.
Outlet is located on a busy main road where parking is difficult to find. The staff is good & helpful. They do have lot of seating space available along with take away & delivery. Quality of same as always is as per the brand standards. They have option of only tinned beverages as Plastic Bottle is Banned in Entire Nilgiris Regions.
